sentence.Network_en: Flowers are often fertilized by bees as they gather nectar.

sentence.Network_en: Hummingbirds have discovered that nectar and pollen are very nutritious.
sentence.Network_cn: 蜂鸟发现花蜜和花粉是很有营养的.

sentence.Network_en: Insects are attracted to flowers by their colour, scent and nectar.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in sense 2): via Latin from Greek nektar

entry.def: Nectar is a sweet liquid produced by flowers, which bees and other insects collect.

entry.tran: 甘露;(尤指酒类)琼浆玉液
entry.def: If you refer to a drink, especially an alcoholic drink, as nectar, you think it tastes very nice.

example.ex: Tony sipped from his glass. 'Mmm. Ambrosia. Nectar of the gods. Divine. Wonderful.'
example.tran: 托尼从杯中抿了一口感叹道：“哇，人间美味啊，神灵的琼浆玉液呀，天赐之物，太棒了。”

means.word_mean: 1. a sweet liquid secretion that is attractive to pollinators
3. (classical mythology) the food and drink of the gods; mortals who ate it became immortal
